data.title: Fixes crates getting collected by buildings or other crates
data.body:
Long overdue fix for a regression I introduced.

Closes #5953. (Or should, it is very hard to test that specific case.)

Based on code from #6159.
(Tested NRE crash case reported in #6159. Buildings no longer collect crates dropped on them.)

data.title: Improves tab completion in chat.
data.body:
Pressing tab after completion now cycles to the next candidate.

Moves the completion code in LobbyLogic and InGameChatLogic to a common class.

data.title: Game choppy/slow on large/huge maps
data.body: Game is slow on large or huge maps. This happenes when you play on big maps. It gets worse and worse during gameplay.

data.title: Added InaccuracyModifier
data.body: As title says.

data.title: Reload UI/mod Options
data.body:
@pavlos256's CTRL+SHIFT+C hotkey is really useful to reload chrome.png but I think it would be interesting to enhance this hotkey even further.

There could be a new button in "Debug" options to choose which yaml files to reload.

![screenshot002](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/4028830/b78e8976-2c43-11e4-9025-1dd6932e7422.png)

![screenshot003](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/4028831/b9eeb0ce-2c43-11e4-9799-4d97c112c540.png)

This would help modders quickly test their balance changes and also help those who work on the UI, to reload the modified files without restarting OpenRA everytime.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4025008-reload-ui-mod-options?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: TS TestAI and more.
data.body:
Fix `GAPOWR`.
Fix `PROC`.
Add `Guard`/`Guardable` to `^Helicopter`.
Add `GASILO`.
Add TS Test AI

`^Building` now has `FrozenUnderFog`.

data.title: Unable to Alt+Tab out of window when 'Lock mouse to window' enabled
data.body:
I'm currently playing with release-20140722 under Debian Testing, n00b user seeing how things have changed since the PlayStation era.

With 'Lock mouse to window' enabled, I'm supposed to be able to Alt+Tab out of the window - however both during play and on the settings screen, Alt+Tabbing just causes the machine buzzer to beep at me - this is supposed to be possible according to https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4977
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4015894-unable-to-alt-tab-out-of-window-when-lock-mouse-to-window-enabled?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add missing INotifyRemovedFromWorld impl to GlobalUpgradable
data.body: Fixes #6214

data.title: Mouse movement is limited by wrong monitor.
data.body:
I have a dual monitor setup in Linux. First monitor is 1680x1050 and the second is 1920x1080. I use Pseudo-Fullscreen, which results to a 1920x1080 sized window without borders in the second monitor.

Everything works perfectly until I either switch to another virtual desktop and back to OpenRA, or if I minimize OpenRA and then restore it. After this, the mouse refuses to move out of 1680x1050 area, so basically the whole left sidebar is inaccessible and a small 30 pixel area at the bottom too.

Switching to another application does not cause this. Once this happens, I have no idea how to disable it, other than restarting the game.

This started to happen after I upgraded from 20131223 to 20140722.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4015101-mouse-movement-is-limited-by-wrong-monitor?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Unexpected behaviour on SpreadDamageWarhead -> Range
data.body:
While rebasing and testing #6252 I noticed that if you specify only one entry in the Range (not the usually used spread) for a SpreadDamageWarhead, it will always return a 0 as the modifier for falloff, resulting in no damage done.

I tracked it down to this method:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.RA/Warheads/SpreadDamageWarhead.cs#L71-L84

It seems to assume a minimum of at least 2 range entries, otherwise it returns 0.

I apologize for not picking up on this while testing #6265.

data.title: "better" openra.net/games list
data.body:
I'm not sure if its appropriate to open issues about the main site here... anyway:
I think the games list on the site could use some grouping/sorting.

![Example image](http://i.imgur.com/XmDdm19.png)

On the right is the current list.
The left list is ordered as follow:  
- **release** _(current stable <-> others)_  
  - **mod** _(openra <-> cnc <-> d2k <-> others)_  
    - **server State** _(playing <-> waiting)_  
      - **number of players**  

I made the this JavaScript to do the sorting: http://pastebin.com/5tLZ0aFK
It is dependent on Underscore.js : http://underscorejs.org/
The above 2 scripts need to be added to the html in addition to the following change:
Line 90 from this:
`var masterReply = jQuery.parseJSON(masterMessage);`
To this:
`var masterReply = format(jQuery.parseJSON(masterMessage));`

data.title: Rename the different traits that use original names?
data.body:
Suggestion to polish the definitions in yaml's for mods.

Rename the different traits that use carry-over names from the proprietary games, such as IronCurtainable: or CrateMcvAction.

Make them something more generalized, like Forcefield: or CrateVehicleAction.

---
- [x] IronCurtainable #6556
- [x] SupplyTruck ~~#5925~~ #13000
- [x] OreRefinery #7098
- [x] PoisonedByTiberium ~~#7110~~ #11499
- [ ] Chronoshift*
- [ ] PortableChrono
- [x] C4Demolition #11294
- [ ] Gps*
- [ ] MadTank #10808
- [ ] CncLoadScreen
- [ ] CncMainMenuLogic
- [x] DemoTruck #10371
- [x] SpawnVisceroid #8744
- [ ] Bib #9398
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/4012536-rename-the-different-traits-that-use-original-names?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fix end game window conflicting with ingame menu
data.body:
This causes the menu to close itself when the game is over.

Fixes #6311.

data.title: Fixed a crash when parachutes were spawned outside of the map
data.body: as described in #6302. Probably a regression of my https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5695.

data.title: Fixed building animations staying paused when disabled due to low power during sell causing glitches
data.body: Both #6076 and #6275 are duplicates. Probably introduced by myself in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5138.

data.title: Tiberium dawn SSM launcher and Commando problems
data.body:
SSM launcher cannot shoot at anything
Commando cannot shoot vehicle.

data.title: Fixed Dune 2000 infantry not showing the waiting animation when ordered to stop firing
data.body: The issue has been described at #5884 1). The 2) is actually a duplicate of #3706 and not resolved here.

data.title: Fixed double click sound on Tiberian Dawn production tabs
data.body: It always clicked twice. Once for the main group and second for the production building number. I think that is what #5863 is about. At least that is what disturbs me.

data.title: Unhardcoded and self-documented more resource/smudge parameters
data.body: Tried to fix #6270, but failed as all offsets are ignored. Hopefully the cleanup commit is still useful.

data.title: Small cleanup on fort-lonestar map
data.body:
Still one issue left:
You can't build any infantry units. But I have no idea, why this happens.
(I think it is something with the produces trait.)
